intro: Calandrinia howellii, commonly known as Howell's purslane, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the family Portulacaceae, which includes other species of purslanes. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological resilience make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
